request.description:
### Update Author Details

This endpoint allows the client to update the details of a specific author.

#### Request Body

- `name`: (string) The updated name of the author.
    

Example:

``` json
{
    "name": "Updated Author Name"
}

 ```

#### Response

- Status: 200
    
- Content-Type: application/json
    

Example Response Body:

``` json
{
    "message": "",
    "author": {
        "_id": "",
        "name": "",
        "bio": "",
        "createdAt": "",
        "updatedAt": "",
        "__v": 0
    }
}

 ```

### Delete Author by ID

This endpoint is used to delete an author by their unique ID.

#### Request Body

This request does not require a request body.

#### Response

- Status: 200
    
- Content-Type: application/json
    

Example Response Body:

``` json
{
    "message": ""
}

 ```

### Upload Author Image

This endpoint allows you to upload an image for a specific author.

#### Request Body

- `authorId` (text): The ID of the author for whom the image is being uploaded.
    
- `image` (file): The image file to be uploaded.
    

#### Response

Upon a successful upload, the server responds with a status code of 200 and a JSON object containing:

- `message`: A message indicating the success of the upload.
    
- `coverImage`: The URL or identifier of the uploaded image.
    

#### Example

``` json
{
    "message": "Image uploaded successfully",
    "coverImage": "https://example.com/author/image.jpg"
}

 ```

### Add Category

This endpoint allows you to add a new category.

#### Request Body

- `name`: (string) The name of the category.
    
- `description`: (string) The description of the category.
    

Example:

``` json
{
  "name": "Comedy",
  "description": "Romansa, Hubungan, Cinta kasih"
}

 ```

#### Response

- Status: 400
    
- Content-Type: application/json
    
- `message`: (string) A message indicating the reason for the bad request.
    

Example Response Body:

``` json
{
  "name": "",
  "description": "",
  "_id": "",
  "createdAt": "",
  "updatedAt": "",
  "__v": 0
}

 ```

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of categories. The request does not require any parameters in the request body or URL. The response will be in JSON format and will contain an array of category objects, each with properties such as _id, name, description, createdAt, updatedAt, and __v. The values for these properties will be specific to each category. The status code for a successful response is 200.

response.name: 200 OK Get All

request.description:
### Add Book

This endpoint allows the client to add a new book to the database.

#### Request Body

- title (string): The title of the book.
    
- authorId (string): The ID of the author of the book.
    
- description (string): A brief description of the book.
    
- categoryIds (array of strings): An array of category IDs associated with the book.
    
- stock (number): The stock quantity of the book.
    

#### Response

- Status: 201
    
- Content-Type: application/json
    
- message (string): A message regarding the request.
    
- book (object): Details of the added book including title, authorId, categoryIds, description, stock, _id, createdAt, updatedAt, and __v.
    
- warning (string, optional): A warning message, if any.
    

Example Response:

``` json
{
    "message": "",
    "book": {
        "title": "",
        "authorId": "",
        "categoryIds": [""],
        "description": "",
        "stock": 0,
        "_id": "",
        "createdAt": "",
        "updatedAt": "",
        "__v": 0
    }
}

 ```

response.name: 201 Created
response.body:
{
    "message": "Book created successfully.",
    "book": {
        "title": "Cerita Si Mosul",
        "authorId": "6729a2ed4cf7422b00b4922f",
        "categoryIds": [
            "6729aaddbe772fdba406fe9b",
            "6729aac0be772fdba406fe99"
        ],
        "description": "Menceritakan Perjalanan Hidup Mosul",
        "stock": 10,
        "_id": "6729b1fd83e41596108db508",
        "createdAt": "2024-11-05T05:49:49.237Z",
        "updatedAt": "2024-11-05T05:49:49.237Z",
        "__v": 0
    }
}

response.name: Created but category not found
response.body:
{
    "message": "Book created successfully.",
    "book": {
        "title": "Cerita Si Amal",
        "authorId": "6729a2ed4cf7422b00b4922f",
        "categoryIds": [
            "6729aaddbe772fdba406fe9b"
        ],
        "description": "Menceritakan Amal yang bahagia",
        "stock": 10,
        "_id": "6729b806da308acefcbe240d",
        "createdAt": "2024-11-05T06:15:34.270Z",
        "updatedAt": "2024-11-05T06:15:34.270Z",
        "__v": 0
    },
    "warning": "Category ID berikut belum dimasukkan dalam database categories atau telah dihapus: 6729a862d96b4f31cb8ea5df"
}

request.description:
### Get Books

This endpoint retrieves a list of books.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `http://localhost:3000/api/v1/books`
    

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
    
- Content-Type: application/json
    
- { "massage": "", "book": \[ { "_id": "", "title": "", "authorId": { "_id": "", "name": "", "bio": "" }, "categoryIds": \[ { "_id": "", "name": "", "description": "" } \], "description": "", "stock": 0, "createdAt": "", "updatedAt": "", "__v": 0 } \]}

response.name: 200 OK Get All
After Deleted

request.description:
### Get Book Details

This endpoint retrieves the details of a specific book based on the provided book ID.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- Endpoint: `http://localhost:3000/api/v1/book/:id`
    

#### Response

- Status: 200
    
- Content-Type: application/json
    
- { "book": { "_id": "", "title": "", "authorId": { "_id": "", "name": "" }, "categoryIds": \[ { "_id": "", "name": "" } \], "description": "", "stock": 0, "createdAt": "", "updatedAt": "", "__v": 0, "coverImage": "" } }
    

#### Example Response

``` json
{
    "book": {
        "_id": "",
        "title": "",
        "authorId": {
            "_id": "",
            "name": ""
        },
        "categoryIds": [
            {
                "_id": "",
                "name": ""
            }
        ],
        "description": "",
        "stock": 0,
        "createdAt": "",
        "updatedAt": "",
        "__v": 0,
        "coverImage": ""
    }
}

 ```

response.name: 200 OK Get By ID

request.description:
### Update Book Details

This endpoint allows the user to update the details of a specific book by providing the book ID in the URL path.

#### Request Body

- `title` (string, optional): The updated title of the book.
    
- `description` (string): The updated description of the book.
    

Example:

``` json
{
    "title": "",
    "description": "Perjalanan Anak Ganteng"
}

 ```

#### Response

- Status: 400
    
- Content-Type: application/json
    

Example Response Body:

``` json
{
    "message": "",
    "book": {
        "_id": "",
        "title": "",
        "authorId": {
            "_id": "",
            "name": ""
        },
        "categoryIds": [
            {
                "_id": "",
                "name": ""
            }
        ],
        "description": "",
        "stock": 0,
        "createdAt": "",
        "updatedAt": "",
        "__v": 0
    }
}

 ```

response.name: 200 OK Updated

request.description:
### DELETE /api/v1/book/:id

This endpoint is used to delete a specific book identified by its unique ID.

#### Request Body

This request does not require a request body.

#### Response

- Status: 200
    
- Content-Type: application/json
    

Example Response Body:

``` json
{
    "message": ""
}

 ```

### Upload Book Cover Image

This endpoint allows the client to upload a cover image for a specific book.

#### Request Body

- `bookId` (text): The ID of the book for which the cover image is being uploaded.
    
- `image` (file): The cover image file to be uploaded.
    

#### Response

The response will be a JSON object with the following properties:

- `message` (string): A message indicating the status of the upload process.
    
- `coverImage` (string): The URL or identifier of the uploaded cover image.
    

#### Example Response

``` json
{
    "message": "",
    "coverImage": ""
}

 ```

### Borrower Creation

This endpoint allows the creation of a new borrower.

#### Request Body

- **name** (string, required): The name of the borrower.
    
- **contact** (string, required): The contact information of the borrower.
    

#### Response

The response is in JSON format with the following schema:

``` json
{
  "name": "",
  "contact": "",
  "borrowCount": 0,
  "_id": "",
  "joinAt": "",
  "updatedAt": "",
  "__v": 0
}

 ```

- **name** (string): The name of the borrower.
    
- **contact** (string): The contact information of the borrower.
    
- **borrowCount** (number): The count of borrow actions.
    
- **_id** (string): The unique identifier of the borrower.
    
- **joinAt** (string): The date when the borrower joined.
    
- **updatedAt** (string): The date when the borrower information was last updated.
    
- **__v** (number): Version key for internal use.
    

#### Example Response

``` json
{
  "name": "",
  "contact": "",
  "borrowCount": 0,
  "_id": "",
  "joinAt": "",
  "updatedAt": "",
  "__v": 0
}

 ```

response.name: 400 Bad Request

request.description:
# Get Borrower Details

This endpoint retrieves the details of a specific borrower identified by the provided ID.

## Request

### Path Parameters

- `id` (string, required): The unique identifier of the borrower.
    

## Response

- `borrower` (object): An object containing the details of the borrower.
    
    - `_id` (string): The unique identifier of the borrower.
        
    - `name` (string): The name of the borrower.
        
    - `contact` (string): The contact information of the borrower.
        
    - `borrowCount` (number): The count of items borrowed by the borrower.
        
    - `joinAt` (string): The date when the borrower joined.
        
    - `updatedAt` (string): The date when the borrower details were last updated.
        
    - `__v` (number): Version control field.
        

### Example

``` json
{
  "borrower": {
    "_id": "",
    "name": "",
    "contact": "",
    "borrowCount": 0,
    "joinAt": "",
    "updatedAt": "",
    "__v": 0
  }
}

 ```

### Update Borrower Details

This endpoint allows the client to update the details of a specific borrower.

#### Request Body

- `name` (string, optional): The updated name of the borrower.
    
- `contact` (string): The updated contact information of the borrower.
    

#### Response

The response is in JSON format and includes the following fields:

- `message` (string): A message indicating the result of the request.
    
- `borrower` (object): An object containing the updated details of the borrower, including `_id`, `name`, `contact`, `borrowCount`, `joinAt`, `updatedAt`, and `__v`.
    

#### Example Response

``` json
{
    "message": "",
    "borrower": {
        "_id": "",
        "name": "",
        "contact": "",
        "borrowCount": 0,
        "joinAt": "",
        "updatedAt": "",
        "__v": 0
    }
}

 ```

response.name: 400 Bad Request

request.description:
### Borrow Book

This endpoint allows users to borrow a book by providing the book ID, borrower ID, and the duration for which the book will be borrowed.

#### Request Body

- `bookId` (string): The ID of the book being borrowed.
    
- `borrowerId` (string): The ID of the borrower.
    
- `borrowDurationDays` (integer): The number of days for which the book will be borrowed.
    

#### Response

Upon successful borrowing, the endpoint returns a status code of 201 and a JSON object with the following structure:

``` json
{
    "message": "",
    "borrow": {
        "bookId": "",
        "borrowerId": "",
        "borrowDate": "",
        "dueDate": "",
        "status": "",
        "_id": "",
        "createdAt": "",
        "updatedAt": "",
        "__v": 0
    }
}

 ```

The `borrow` object contains details of the borrowed book, including the book ID, borrower ID, borrow date, due date, status, and other metadata.

#### Example Response

``` json
{
    "message": "",
    "borrow": {
        "bookId": "",
        "borrowerId": "",
        "borrowDate": "",
        "dueDate": "",
        "status": "",
        "_id": "",
        "createdAt": "",
        "updatedAt": "",
        "__v": 0
    }
}

 ```

### GET /api/v1/borrow/book/list

This endpoint retrieves a list of active borrows for books.

#### Request

No request body is required for this endpoint.

#### Response

The response will be a JSON object with the following properties:

- `massage` (string): A message, if any.
    
- `activeBorrows` (array): An array of active borrow objects, each containing the following properties:
    
    - `_id` (string): The ID of the borrow.
        
    - `bookId` (object): An object representing the book, with the following properties:
        
        - `_id` (string): The ID of the book.
            
        - `title` (string): The title of the book.
            
    - `borrowerId` (object): An object representing the borrower, with the following properties:
        
        - `_id` (string): The ID of the borrower.
            
        - `name` (string): The name of the borrower.
            
        - `contact` (string): The contact information of the borrower.
            
    - `borrowDate` (string): The date of borrowing.
        
    - `dueDate` (string): The due date for returning the book.
        
    - `status` (string): The status of the borrow.
        
    - `createdAt` (string): The date of creation.
        
    - `updatedAt` (string): The date of last update.
        
    - `__v` (number): Version control.
        

#### Example

``` json
{
    "massage": "",
    "activeBorrows": [
        {
            "_id": "",
            "bookId": {
                "_id": "",
                "title": ""
            },
            "borrowerId": {
                "_id": "",
                "name": "",
                "contact": ""
            },
            "borrowDate": "",
            "dueDate": "",
            "status": "",
            "createdAt": "",
            "updatedAt": "",
            "__v": 0
        }
    ]
}

 ```

response.name: 200 OK Get All
